pullRequest.body:
This PR replaces the companion `(B : BilinForm R M)` of a quadratic form with a bilinear map `(B : M â†’â‚—[R] M â†’â‚—[R] R)`.

This is intended as a baby step towards generalising quadratic forms to quadratic maps. In the future we could allow for companion bilinear or even sesquilinear maps into an `R`-module.

---

I've previously tried to go straight to quadratic maps (#7569) but it's making for a PR that is too big and unwieldy. This PR is hopefully more achievable.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/4dd6e015-50bb-4c78-89ae-3d93f5e54c19) for commit 4a55b3a17be6f87159ca462507544ef5078db923.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/17ce961b-9c36-4388-adce-01fcf9add9c5/to/4dd6e015-50bb-4c78-89ae-3d93f5e54c19) against commit e8bfb678dad1331ef34cf9531144b5295b96ece9:
```diff
  Benchmark                                                           Metric         Change
  =========================================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.FilteredColimitCommutesFiniteLimit   instructions   -19.2%
- ~Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.Basic                          instructions    16.9%
```

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/3fc30fbb-aa45-4821-bfbb-3cffbe76b21c) for commit bdecf41a970ae6fa1c79aec74f1644e4199bbb4d.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/c6086b9b-94ab-4799-8930-86f81fd7d13f/to/3fc30fbb-aa45-4821-bfbb-3cffbe76b21c) against commit 0a0bb6ecfe660436337da7631a532f61a804079f:
```diff
  Benchmark                                    Metric         Change
  ==================================================================
- ~Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.Basic   instructions    16.8%
```
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by mcdoll.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7741418743/job/21108396806)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7741418743/job/21108396168)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7741418743/job/21108396591)
Thank you so much, I would be very happy if we could remove `BilinForm` entirely from mathlib and this is a big step.

untested:
```suggestion
def toQuadraticForm (B : BilinForm R M) : QuadraticForm R M :=
  B.toLin.toQuadraticForm
```

There is [LinearMap.SeparatingLeft](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/SesquilinearForm.html#LinearMap.SeparatingLeft) which is the same as `BilinForm.Nondegenerate`.

```suggestion
theorem separatingLeft_dualProd :
```
and probably there is an #align that has to be changed as well
This looks like a regression to me; one implies the other so there should be no need for both

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(LinearAlgebra/QuadraticForm/Basic): Use bilinear maps for the companion
